Adult male (Northern).description: American Kestrels are much less heavily marked below than Merlins and they lack the Merlin's white tail bands.

Female (Northern).description: Female American Kestrels have bolder black markings on the face than Merlins. Females have barring on the back, unlike the solid brown back of Merlins.

Adult.description: Adult Prairie Falcons have cleaner underparts than Merlins. They also have a stronger mustache mark than Merlins.

Immature.description: Prairie Falcons can readily be separated from Merlins in flight by their dark “armpit” patches, visible on both immatures and adults.

Adult.description: Peregrine Falcons are larger than Merlins with a bigger chest and broader wings than Merlins. They also have a hooded look and a stronger mustache.

Adult (Northern).description: Sharp-shinned Hawks have more rounded wings than the pointed wings of Merlins. The tail is also longer than the Merlin's tail.
